Definition: Court in which case was filed
Case number assigned to case by court
Two-letter case type (e.g., "CF" for felony, "CM" for misdemeanor)
Judge initally assigned to the case
First name associated with a plaintiff in the list of parties
First name associated with a defendant in the list of parties
Free-text description of top (first) count listed on case at time of initial data collection
OJO-generated description of the case issue; possible values are "EVICTION", "DEBT", "FORECLOSURE", and "OTHER".
Date of disposition of top count

For OSCN courts, the last disposition entered in a case.

For ODCR courts, count-level dispositions are not available. In these cases, the code searches the text in the minute description with one of the following character strings is assumed to be the disposition: "DEFAULT" indicating "DEFAULT JUDGMENT"; "DISMISS" indicating "DISMISSED"; "MEDIA" indicating "MEDIATION"; or "JUDG" indicating "JUDGMENT". The strings are searched in the above order, and the last minute containing one of the strings is used as the case disposition.
Date that case summary data was compiled
